news.title: Amini Soma-Phiri Bounces Back at Highlanders …
news.content:
Sports Correspondent

Highlanders FC have welcomed back former club stalwart Amini Soma-Phiri, who has been appointed as the teams new Welfare Manager.

Soma-Phiri is no stranger to the Bulawayo giants, having previously served as assistant coach under then-head coach Erol Akbay. Before moving into coaching, he was a key player for Highlanders, earning a reputation for his commitment and passion for the club.

His return is seen as a boost for Bosso, with his deep understanding of the teams culture and history expected to help strengthen the players support systems both on and off the pitch.

news.title: Thembinkosi Lorch Leaves Sundowns
news.content:
Sports Correspondent

Mamelodi Sundowns have officially confirmed the departure of star attacking midfielder Thembinkosi Lorch, bringing an end to his stint with the Pretoria-based giants.

Lorch, who joined Sundowns from Orlando Pirates in a high-profile transfer, made an impact during his time at the club with his creativity, skill, and ability to change games in an instant. However, his stay was relatively short-lived, with his exit now paving the way for a return to familiar territory.

Reports indicate that the 31-year-old is set to rejoin Moroccan powerhouse Wydad Casablanca on a permanent deal. Lorch previously featured for the North African side earlier in his career, and the move is expected to reignite his career on the continental stage.

While Sundowns have yet to reveal the finer details of the transfer, the club thanked Lorch for his contributions and wished him success in his next chapter. For Wydad fans, his homecoming will be seen as a major boost ahead of the new season.
news.description:
Sports Correspondent Mamelodi Sundowns have officially confirmed the departure of star attacking midfielder Thembinkosi Lorch, bringing an end to his …

Continue reading "Thembinkosi Lorch Leaves Sundowns"

news.title: No Elections In 2028, Declares Garwe
news.content:
By A Correspondent

ZANU PF Mashonaland East provincial chairman, Daniel Garwe, has sparked controversy by suggesting that President Emmerson Mnangagwas tenure could continue past the scheduled 2028 elections. Speaking to a ZANU PF district coordinating committee on 11 August, Garwe hailed the Presidents Vision 2030 economic blueprint as unstoppable, claiming that no force could derail it.

There will be no election in 2028, Garwe told party officials, emphasizing that the country would continue to focus on development regardless of political opposition. Were moving towards 2030, building the nation, whether anyone approves or not. Nothing can stop this agenda.

Garwe appeared to take a subtle swipe at Vice-PresidentConstantino Chiwenga, widely seen as Mnangagwas potential successor. Mocking unnamed rivals, he referenced a bizarre traditional ritual, saying: Some think plucking a live black chicken can change the outcomebut the one in charge remains Mnangagwa. Dont waste effort on empty gestures.

Extending Mnangagwas term beyond constitutional limits would require a formal amendment, a move that is expected to face strong opposition from rival political parties and dissenting members within ZANU PF itself.

Publicly, Mnangagwa has maintained that he will step down when his current term concludes in 2028. Behind the scenes, however, party insiders suggest that loyalists are exploring strategies to block Chiwengas rise and promote businessmanKudakwashe Tagwireias party leader during the 2027 congress. Under this plan, Mnangagwa would officially resign, but Tagwirei, installed as vice president, could effectively extend the ruling factions influence until 2030.

The comments from Garwe have intensified debate about ZANU PFs internal succession dynamics and the potential constitutional and political battles that lie ahead as the country approaches the next election cycle.
news.description:
By A Correspondent ZANU PF Mashonaland East provincial chairman, Daniel Garwe, has sparked controversy by suggesting that President Emmerson Mnangagwa’s …

Continue reading "No Elections In 2028, Declares Garwe"

news.title: 🚨 U.S. ENTRY OF CONVICTED PREACHER WALTER MAGAYA, AIRPORT ALERT RAISED
news.content:
DALLAS, TEXAS  By Investigative Reporter | ZimEye| U.S. federal and local security agencies have been urged to investigate the imminent arrival of convicted Zimbabwean preacher Walter Magaya, who is scheduled to land in Dallas, Texas within a few hours from now.

Magaya, who has a criminal conviction in Harare for selling unregulated chemical substances that resulted in the deaths of at least four individuals in Zimbabwe, is reportedly entering the United States without disclosing to airport and border authorities that he intends to engage in unlicensed medical practice during his stay.

Key Security Concerns:1. Unlicensed Medical Practice: Magaya has a documented history of administering unregulated chemicals and performing medical treatments without a license. His conviction in Zimbabwe followed fatal incidents involving toxic substances given to at least 4 members of his congregation.2. Ongoing Money Laundering Schemes: Since 2016, Magaya has operated alleged investment and property share schemes which investigative reports and victim testimonies confirm are fraudulent. Victims have sold property or invested life savings only to find no legitimate shares or assets existed, resulting in widespread financial ruin.

There are police cases in UK, South Africa and Zimbabwe.3. Sexual Exploitation Allegations: Police statements and Magayas own admissions during prior detentions in Zimbabwe reveal a pattern of grooming women for sexual purposes, followed by out-of-court payoffs to suppress complaints. Complainants have been pressured into signing non-disclosure agreements prepared by his legal team, in exchange for fake compensation promises.4. Outstanding Zimbabwe Revenue Authority (ZIMRA) Investigation: Magaya remains a suspect in money laundering and tax evasion cases linked to undeclared foreign transactions dating back to 2017.5. Documented Pattern of Concealment: Multiple international media outlets have reported on Magayas use of deception to mask his true purpose of travel, including nondisclosure of planned commercial or medical activities to immigration and customs officials.

The continued alleging. His luggage must be searched including that of other travellers on the plane, cause he uses decoys.

Magayas lawyer Emerson Chatambudza was reached for comment.

This is a developing security situation.
news.description:
DALLAS, TEXAS — —By Investigative Reporter | ZimEye| U.S. federal and local security agencies have been urged to investigate the …

news.title: Tshabangu Fails To Field Candidate For Masvingo By-Election
news.content:
By Tinashe Sambiri

MASVINGO  The controversial Citizens Coalition for Change (CCC) Secretary General, Senator Sengezo Tshabangu, has failed to field a candidate for the upcoming Masvingo Urban Ward 7 by-election, raising questions about the partys internal leadership struggles.

The by-election, scheduled for 13 September 2025, follows the death of CCC Councillor Tafara Masimba in July. The nomination court convened on Thursday at the Civic Centre, where five candidates successfully completed the submission of their nomination papers, none representing the CCC under Tshabangus leadership.

The five candidates in the race are:

Struggle Desire Nyahunda (Independent)

Prosper Tiringindi (Independent)

Tsungai Mandati (Independent, widow of the late Tafara Masimba)

Simbarashe Shonhiwa (Zanu PF)

Prosper Mataruse (MDC-T)

The failure to field a candidate comes after Tshabangu seized control of the CCC, prompting the partys founder, Advocate Nelson Chamisa, to quit, citing heavy infiltration and interference within the party.

Zimbabwe Electoral Commission (ZEC) officials stressed the need for a peaceful electoral process, saying:

Shun violence we want a peaceful election, adding that all candidates and supporters must conduct themselves responsibly throughout the campaign period.

ZEC further reminded voters to adhere to electoral guidelines and to report any suspicious activities to ensure a free, fair, and safe by-election.

Campaigning is expected to intensify in the coming weeks as the remaining candidates seek to secure the support of Masvingo Urban Ward 7 residents.
news.description:
By Tinashe Sambiri MASVINGO – The controversial Citizens Coalition for Change (CCC) Secretary General, Senator Sengezo Tshabangu, has failed to …

Continue reading "Tshabangu Fails To Field Candidate For Masvingo By-Election"

news.title: Stop Kungwavha Ngwavha Declares Mnangagwa  as Citizens Face Daily Struggles
news.content:
By A Correspondent

President Emmerson Mnangagwa has urged Zimbabwes youth to reject dishonesty, corruption, and the lure of quick money, even as the nation grapples with deepening economic hardship and persistent corruption allegations.

Speaking at the Zanu PF Youth League National Executive meeting in Harare on Thursday, Mnangagwa called on young people to abandon what he described as the dependency syndrome and instead become creators, not mere consumers; builders, not beggars.

Shun quick money be disciplined, he told the gathering, warning against the temptation to make easy money and the dangers of a quick-fix mentality.

Critics, however, say such calls ring hollow in a country where corruption scandals among political elites are widespread, and economic opportunities for ordinary citizens  especially the youth  remain extremely limited.

Many observers argue that Mnangagwas lectures on discipline are increasingly out of touch with the daily struggles faced by ordinary Zimbabweans. Calls for self-reliance are meaningless when citizens are left to navigate unemployment, inflation, and systemic corruption with no support, they say.

While the Presidents message emphasizes self-reliance, many young Zimbabweans contend that without addressing entrenched corruption at the highest levels, such appeals remain largely rhetorical, offering little practical guidance on how citizens can survive and thrive amid the ongoing crisis.
news.description:
By A Correspondent President Emmerson Mnangagwa has urged Zimbabwe’s youth to reject dishonesty, corruption, and the lure of “quick money,” …

Continue reading "Stop Kungwavha Ngwavha Declares Mnangagwa as Citizens Face Daily Struggles"

news.title: Five Candidates Set to Contest In Masvingo Urban Ward 7 By-Election
news.content:
By Tinashe Sambiri

MASVINGO  Five candidates have completed the submission of their nomination papers for the Masvingo Urban Ward 7 by-election scheduled for 13 September 2025, according to the Zimbabwe Electoral Commission (ZEC).

The nomination court convened on Thursday at the Civic Centre to receive papers from interested contestants.

The by-election comes after the death of CCC Councillor Tafara Masimba in July, leaving the seat vacant.

Notably, the Citizens Coalition for Change (CCC) has opted not to field a candidate for this poll.

The five candidates vying for the seat are:

Struggle Desire Nyahunda (Independent)

Prosper Tiringindi (Independent)

Tsungai Mandati (Independent, widow of the late Tafara Masimba)

Simbarashe Shonhiwa (Zanu PF)

Prosper Mataruse (MDC-T)

ZEC officials emphasized the importance of a peaceful electoral process, stating:

Shun violence we want a peaceful election, they urged, adding that all candidates and supporters must conduct themselves responsibly throughout the campaign period.

The Commission further reminded voters to adhere to electoral guidelines and to report any suspicious activities to the authorities to ensure a free, fair, and safe by-election.

Campaigning is expected to intensify in the coming weeks as candidates seek to secure the support of Masvingo City Ward 7 residents.
news.description:
By Tinashe Sambiri MASVINGO – Five candidates have completed the submission of their nomination papers for the Masvingo Urban Ward …

Continue reading "Five Candidates Set to Contest In Masvingo Urban Ward 7 By-Election"

news.title: Auxillia Mnangagwa Bombs Women Investment Conference With 2030 Agenda
news.content:
By A Correspondent

In yet another heavily scripted government event dressed up as empowerment, First Lady Dr Auxillia Mnangagwa will headline the inaugural three-day Bulawayo Women Investment Conference next month  a gathering critics say risks being more about political branding and Vision 2030 sloganeering than addressing the real economic struggles women face.

The conference, set for September 3 to 5, is being organised by the Office of the Minister of State for Bulawayo Provincial Affairs and Devolution in partnership with the Bulawayo City Council. Organisers claim it will promote economic independence and leadership among women, despite many questioning whether such platforms translate into tangible change on the ground.

Speaking at a press briefing yesterday, Bulawayo Provincial Affairs and Devolution Minister Judith Ncube said: I am excited to advise you that the Office of the Minister of State for Provincial Affairs and Devolution, Bulawayo Metropolitan Province, in collaboration with the City of Bulawayo, will host the inaugural three-day Bulawayo Women Investment Conference 2025. Through this conference, we aspire to empower women by providing them with the tools, knowledge, and connections necessary to navigate the investment landscape, thereby contributing to the overall economic development of Bulawayo and beyond.

Minister Ncube linked the initiative directly to the governments 2030 targets, saying: As we work towards achieving upper-middle-class income status by 2030, investing in womens economic potential is essential. This conference marks a critical step in building a future where women are equal drivers of our nations prosperity.

The event will feature sessions on investment strategies, financial literacy, leadership, mentorship, and access to funding. According to Ncube, We also engaged with different women who are into different businesses and in different levels. We strongly believe we can do it as Bulawayo and as people from Zimbabwe, hence we are going to gather from the 3rd to the 5th of September to discuss all those issues.

Organisers say the conference is informed by international engagements such as the Egyptian Programme and the 27th Arab-African Investment and International Cooperation Summit in Aswan, Egypt. It is also aligned with global frameworks including the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women (CEDAW), the African Unions Agenda 2063, and the UN Sustainable Development Goals.

Despite the lofty rhetoric, many women in Bulawayo continue to face systemic barriers  from lack of access to capital to the collapse of local industries  with little evidence that high-profile conferences alone will resolve these entrenched challenges.
news.description:
By A Correspondent In yet another heavily scripted government event dressed up as empowerment, First Lady Dr Auxillia Mnangagwa will …

Continue reading "Auxillia Mnangagwa Bombs Women Investment Conference With 2030 Agenda"

news.title: Zanu PF Chairman Declares ‘No Elections in 2028’ as Mnangagwa Allies Plot Term Extension
news.content:
President Emmerson Mnangagwas Mashonaland East provincial chairman, Daniel Garwe, has told party structures there will be no elections in 2028  a statement likely to fuel speculation that the presidents allies are pushing to extend his rule beyond the constitutional limit.

Speaking at a Zanu PF district coordinating committee meeting on August 11, Garwe declared that Vision 2030  Mnangagwas economic plan  was unstoppable and that no-one born of a woman could derail it.

There is no election. DCC, do you hear? There are no elections. Were going to 2030 building the country, whether they like it or not, shame or no shame, were unstoppable, Garwe said, in what appeared to be a swipe at Vice President Constantino Chiwenga, widely seen as Mnangagwas most likely successor.

Garwe also ridiculed unnamed rivals, alleging that one plucked a live black chicken in a failed bid to gain power, before adding: The one ruling is Mnangagwa Dont kill chickens in vain.

Any extension of Mnangagwas presidency would require constitutional amendments  a move certain to draw fierce opposition both outside and within Zanu PF.

Party insiders told ZimLive that while Mnangagwa has publicly insisted he will leave office when his term ends in 2028, some of his allies are quietly working on a plan to block Chiwengas rise. The reported strategy involves positioning sanctioned business magnate Kudakwashe Tagwirei to take over the party leadership at the Zanu PF congress in 2027.

Under the proposal, Mnangagwa would step down as scheduled, Tagwirei  by then installed as vice president  would serve out an extended presidential term until 2030. If successful, it would be the first time in Zimbabwes history that a businessman, rather than a career politician or military figure, ascends to the presidency.
news.description:
President Emmerson Mnangagwa’s Mashonaland East provincial chairman, Daniel Garwe, has told party structures there will be “no elections in 2028” …

Continue reading "Zanu PF Chairman Declares ‘No Elections in 2028’ as Mnangagwa Allies Plot Term Extension"
